Class Matcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • Matcher

  • public class Matcher
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to match children of two elements

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private double F
      Minimum similarity that two nodes must have in order to be matched, regarding their attributes
      private CustomElement left
      The two input roots
      private java.util.HashMap<CustomElement,Partner> leftPartners
      Saved partners for each node, l2r and r2l
      private CustomElement right
      The two input roots
      private java.util.HashMap<CustomElement,Partner> rightPartners
      Saved partners for each node, l2r and r2l
      private double T
      Minimum similarity that two nodes must have in order to be matched, regarding percentage of equal children
      private java.util.ArrayList<CustomElement> unmatchedLefts
      At any point, this list holds all the left nodes that still need a bestMatch

    • Method Detail

      • saveMatch

        private void saveMatch(CustomElement l,
                       CustomElement r,
                       java.lang.Double value)
        After it is determined that two elements are the currently best bestMatch for each other, save the bestMatch
        Parameters:
        l - The left element
        r - The right element
        value - The similarity between the two elements

      • updateMatchIfCurrentBest

        private void updateMatchIfCurrentBest(CustomElement l,
                                      CustomElement r,
                                      java.lang.Double value)
        Check if the found bestMatch is currently the best bestMatch for both elements. Save the bestMatch if so. We use the stable marriage problem to ensure a perfect matching https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stable_marriage_problem
        Parameters:
        l - The left element
        r - The right element
        value - The similarity between the two elements

      • bestMatch

        java.util.ArrayList<java.util.HashMap<CustomElement,CustomElement>> bestMatch(CustomElement l,
                                                                              CustomElement r)
                                                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        This matching algorithm is different from the paper. It describes an algorithm that calculates 'good matches', and not 'best matches'. We use the solution of the stable marriage problem, to ensure the best possible matches. This algorithm is more time-consuming, but gives better results.
        Parameters:
        l - The left root
        r - The right root
        Returns:
        Two maps that bestMatch left nodes to right nodes and vice versa.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - This exception is thrown when the sizes of the l2r map and r2l map don't match

      • outputResult

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.util.HashMap<CustomElement,CustomElement>> outputResult()
        After the bestMatch is complete, return the data in the desired format
        Returns:
        l2r and r2l in a list
